alert.note: Alert for Chariton; Randolph (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:08PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Randolph, eastern Chariton and southeastern Macon Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 207 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Huntsville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Macon, Bevier, Cairo, Jacksonville and Excello. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
